Subject: max-trans-hop question
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=241416423

Hello,

I did a host scope crawl with max-trans-hops set to 1. I thought that would 
set a max to the number of non-L hops at the end of a discovery path.
I am still seeing in the crawl log entries with many Xs on the end of their 
discovery path like this one:

2006-01-12T22:00:09.050Z   200       5842 
http://www.deas.harvard.edu/projects/weitzlab/cgi-bin/webcal/webcal.cgi?function=addform&date=19950413&cal=Bohlin+Rheometer 
LLLLLXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX 
http://www.deas.harvard.edu/projects/weitzlab/cgi-bin/webcal/webcal.cgi?function=webday&date=19950413&cal=Bohlin%20Rheometer 
text/html #026 20060112220008523+523 EXF54S6J3GGVMPONEIZBAUB4DYFPBQL7 -

Yes, a web calendar...
I was thinking that if I could control the number of Xs on the end of the 
discovery path then I could get it to filter out these type of things 
automatically.

thanks,
Andrea
